meanings.definition: A machine used to separate mixtures into their individual components.
meanings.sent1: The chromatograph helped scientists identify the different parts of the mixture.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician operated the chromatograph to separate the substances.
meanings.sent3: The chromatograph decided to take a break from sorting out mixtures.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a chromatograph, carefully dissecting each thought into its components.
meanings.sent5: The chromatograph hummed softly as it worked its magic on the mixture.

meanings.definition: To analyze or separate substances using a chromatograph.
meanings.sent1: Scientists chromatograph the samples to understand their composition.
meanings.sent2: She will chromatograph the compounds to determine their purity.
meanings.sent3: I tried to chromatograph my messy room but got overwhelmed.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to chromatograph every detail of the painting before him.
meanings.sent5: The detective chromatographed the evidence to solve the case.
